commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I526c5b8f99a35e74da060c1933d26d949ab1d487
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1df6ef7d5645cf370c959d8b2577f20ad7917ef9

subject: Fix setting of VIP QoS policy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-04-03 13:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/api/drivers/amphora_driver/driver.py', 'octavia/api/v2/controllers/load_balancer.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/common/test_validations.py', 'octavia/network/drivers/neutron/base.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/api/drivers/amphora_driver/test_amphora_driver.py', 'octavia/network/base.py', 'octavia/network/drivers/noop_driver/driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-vip-qos-policy-extension-enabled-3e16e1c23a7d7ae5.yaml', 'octavia/tests/functional/api/v2/test_load_balancer.py', 'octavia/common/validate.py'], 'message': "Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return
  HTTP 202 to the user.

Story: 2004602
Task: 28512

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return
  HTTP 202 to the user.

Story: 2004602
Task: 28512

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c

subject: Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-01 19:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/baremetal/tasks/pre-install.yml'], 'message': 'Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)

subject: [Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-01 21:31:32.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/rabbitmq.yaml'], 'message': '[Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade

When running a major upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer major
version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running Erlang
Port Mapper Daemon (epmd).

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]

This confuses RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

   ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

   $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
   Error: invalid parameter: []

Since we already stop RabbitMQ before yum update, make sure to
also stop the running Erlang VM and let RabbitMQ restart it
automatically after the yum update.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I52c2ae8bc53cd26ceae2ffa110c42dcb9392b99a
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade

When running a major upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer major
version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running Erlang
Port Mapper Daemon (epmd).

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]

This confuses RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

   ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

   $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
   Error: invalid parameter: []

Since we already stop RabbitMQ before yum update, make sure to
also stop the running Erlang VM and let RabbitMQ restart it
automatically after the yum update.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I52c2ae8bc53cd26ceae2ffa110c42dcb9392b99a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-04-02 10:13:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume/quobyte.py', 'nova/tests/unit/privsep/test_idmapshift.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_quobyte.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/mgmt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/privsep/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py'], 'message': 'Style corrections for privsep usage.

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

I've corrected the existing style mismatches to make things consistent.
Note that the next patch in this series covers this case with a
hacking check.

Change-Id: Ief177dbcb018da6fbad13bb0ff153fc47292d5b9
'}]
commit_message:
Style corrections for privsep usage.

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

I've corrected the existing style mismatches to make things consistent.
Note that the next patch in this series covers this case with a
hacking check.

Change-Id: Ief177dbcb018da6fbad13bb0ff153fc47292d5b9

commit_message:
allow transferring ownership of instance

Adds functionality to placement and nova to allow transferring ownership
of an instance (a consumer in placement-land) from one project to
another (and one user to another). The proposal is for an admin-only
action, done via the REST API.

Change-Id: I08c7370dee330453136931f216d2b54bf4dadc23
blueprint: transfer-ownership

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I272535f2597f770f0964d8b1ed75277f5a1b27df

subject: Added support for the rgw_swift_url parameter in the rgw.pp
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8058, 'name': 'Vangelis Tasoulas', 'email': 'vangelis@schibsted.com', 'username': 'cyberang3l'}, {'_account_id': 9414, 'name': 'zhongshengping', 'email': 'chdzsp@163.com', 'username': 'ZhongShengping'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16137, 'name': 'Tobias Urdin', 'email': 'tobias.urdin@binero.com', 'username': 'tobasco'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-03 16:37:29.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/ceph_rgw_spec.rb', 'spec/defines/ceph_rgw_civetweb_spec.rb', 'manifests/rgw.pp'], 'message': 'Added support for the rgw_swift_url parameter in the rgw.pp

This parameter is needed for the swift API if there is a load balancer
in front of the rados gateway servers. If not provided and the swift
access url is different than http://$::fqdn:port, the swift API is not
working (users get a connection error).

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/mimic/radosgw/config-ref/

Moreover, use the rgw_dns_name option both for civetweb and apache.
This is a valid option for both frontend types, and becomes necessary
if it has been changed at least once in the past.

Change-Id: I639d15e30b0ba6c94614c1650d4ea85258ae6ede
'}]
commit_message:
Added support for the rgw_swift_url parameter in the rgw.pp

This parameter is needed for the swift API if there is a load balancer
in front of the rados gateway servers. If not provided and the swift
access url is different than http://$::fqdn:port, the swift API is not
working (users get a connection error).

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/mimic/radosgw/config-ref/

Moreover, use the rgw_dns_name option both for civetweb and apache.
This is a valid option for both frontend types, and becomes necessary
if it has been changed at least once in the past.

Change-Id: I639d15e30b0ba6c94614c1650d4ea85258ae6ede

commit_message:
Fix capabilities passed as string in agent prepare

The value of capabilities can be either a string or a dict.
There is a function to parse its value and provide a correct
output as expected and it should always be used when reading
node capabilities.

Change-Id: I789fffd5f67eddbe5058581f13d75320ca712897
Story: 2005280
Task: 30133

commit_message:
Fix capabilities passed as string in agent prepare

The value of capabilities can be either a string or a dict.
There is a function to parse its value and provide a correct
output as expected and it should always be used when reading
node capabilities.

Story: 2005280

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifb24fde321815c60e2ac456695c2755da5175994

subject: Handle collections.abc deprecations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-03 15:46:22.000000000', 'files': ['glance/location.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'glance/api/policy.py', 'glance/domain/__init__.py'], 'message': "Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I11e482354725ed74629dcaa9f2b7f229a60aa2a8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I11e482354725ed74629dcaa9f2b7f229a60aa2a8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Quiece 'invalid escape sequence' deprecation msg

Glance tests are currently too verbose for subunit and make
them randomly fail under python 3.

Using raw strings should avoid the DeprecationWarnings around
'invalid escape sequence' being used with the re module.

Change-Id: I14c381ac4b17ca4c5755ed78c55dc44362ab37ef

commit_message:
Clarify policy_file configuration option help text

This options help text was ambiguous and didn't really give readers
a good idea of what policies were or if the path could be relative,
absolute, or both.

This commit attempts to clarify the help text a little bit so that
readers have a little more to go on.

Change-Id: Icda67f07f0ef5ee256113634d29f4662b48140cc

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-03-25 22:23:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix the way to get localhost IP in devstack

In Ubuntu Bionic, the following command returns "uid" so that the
guest-agent service will fail because of invalid IP address.

$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f8
uid
$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1
8.8.8.8 via 10.0.17.1 dev ens3 src 10.0.17.131 uid 0

In Ubuntu Xenial:

$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f8
10.0.17.132
$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1
8.8.8.8 via 192.168.192.1 dev eth0  src 10.0.17.132

Change-Id: Iae24686fa65603b7d22b09da99b7590e4e117454
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the way to get localhost IP in devstack

In Ubuntu Bionic, the following command returns "uid" so that the
guest-agent service will fail because of invalid IP address.

$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f8
uid
$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1
8.8.8.8 via 10.0.17.1 dev ens3 src 10.0.17.131 uid 0

In Ubuntu Xenial:

$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f8
10.0.17.132
$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1
8.8.8.8 via 192.168.192.1 dev eth0  src 10.0.17.132

Change-Id: Iae24686fa65603b7d22b09da99b7590e4e117454

commit_message:
Only allow IP access type for CephFS NFS

For the CephFS NFS back end only ``IP`` access type
is valid so enforce this in the driver.

Also validate access level since there is a utility
routine to check both access type and access level.

Closes-bug: #1816420
Change-Id: I6c96f861b30ef7ccac05a7c199a62f0d69044c3a
(cherry picked from commit 9df750fd19c6c11562b7bf86464185cd63568310)

subject: Handle collections.abc deprecations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-03 15:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I535640779da645e43ba6586308b07bf25dba7d89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I535640779da645e43ba6586308b07bf25dba7d89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-24 20:44:53.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/legacy/aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-mysql/run.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/aodh-dsvm-tempest-plugin-postgresql/run.yaml', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie1e19ff80f313a92536e1f2fd656f02135b5f670
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie1e19ff80f313a92536e1f2fd656f02135b5f670

subject: Use labels to mount filesystems in the guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-03 03:50:18.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deployment_guide.rst'], 'message': "Use labels to mount filesystems in the guide

It was a recommended practice for years to get away from straight
names in /dev, like /dev/sda1, when mounting filesystems. The
man page for mount(8) says:

   The device name of disk partitions are unstable; hardware
   reconfiguration, adding or removing a device can cause change
   in names. This is reason why it's strongly recommended to use
   filesystem or partition identificators like UUID or LABEL.

Nonetheless, novice operators sometimes follow our deployment
guide to the letter and then get into trouble when device names
shift from under their deployments. This patch fixes the problem
without bloating up the guide with general explanations.

Change-Id: I5faae158b62e0395d6e774cd67bd868c785c2186
"}]
commit_message:
Use labels to mount filesystems in the guide

It was a recommended practice for years to get away from straight
names in /dev, like /dev/sda1, when mounting filesystems. The
man page for mount(8) says:

   The device name of disk partitions are unstable; hardware
   reconfiguration, adding or removing a device can cause change
   in names. This is reason why it's strongly recommended to use
   filesystem or partition identificators like UUID or LABEL.

Nonetheless, novice operators sometimes follow our deployment
guide to the letter and then get into trouble when device names
shift from under their deployments. This patch fixes the problem
without bloating up the guide with general explanations.

Change-Id: I5faae158b62e0395d6e774cd67bd868c785c2186

commit_message:
Refactor ResourceProviderListTestCase

Some tests in ResourceProviderListTestCase validated the number of
resource providers returned by p_obj.get_all_by_filters(), but didn't
validate if they are proper resource providers.

This patch adds that check adding a small test helper function,
_run_get_all_by_filters().

Change-Id: Id642d89c854744cbc2d36519004c87e9f2546269

subject: Negative member_of query with microversion 1.32
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25625, 'name': 'Tetsuro Nakamura', 'email': 'tetsuro.nakamura.bc@hco.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'tetsuro0907'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2019-03-29 05:20:43.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/parameters.yaml', 'placement/lib.py', 'placement/objects/allocation_candidate.py', 'placement/microversion.py', 'placement/rest_api_version_history.rst', 'placement/tests/functional/fixtures/gabbits.py', 'placement/tests/functional/gabbits/allocation-candidates-member-of.yaml', 'placement/tests/unit/test_util.py', 'placement/util.py', 'placement/tests/functional/gabbits/resource-provider-aggregates.yaml', 'placement/tests/functional/gabbits/allocation-candidates-bug-1792503.yaml', 'placement/handlers/resource_provider.py', 'placement/tests/functional/gabbits/microversion.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/negative-aggregate-membership-1dde3cbe27c69279.yaml'], 'message': 'Negative member_of query with microversion 1.32

This patch adds microversion 1.32 supporting the forbidden aggregate
expression within existing ``member_of`` queryparam both in
``GET /resource_providers`` and in ``GET /allocation_candidates``.
Forbidden aggregates are prefixed with a ``!``.

We do NOT support ``!`` within the ``in:`` list:

  ?member_of=in:<agg1>,<agg2>,!<agg3>

but we support ``!in:`` prefix:

  ?member_of=!in:<agg1>,<agg2>,<agg3>

which is equivalent to:

  ?member_of=!<agg1>&member_of=!<agg2>&member_of=!<agg3>

where candidate resource providers must not be in agg1, agg2, or agg3.

Change-Id: Ibba7981744c71ab5d4d0ee5d5a40709c6a5c6b5e
Story: 2005297
Task: 30183
'}]
commit_message:
Negative member_of query with microversion 1.32

This patch adds microversion 1.32 supporting the forbidden aggregate
expression within existing ``member_of`` queryparam both in
``GET /resource_providers`` and in ``GET /allocation_candidates``.
Forbidden aggregates are prefixed with a ``!``.

We do NOT support ``!`` within the ``in:`` list:

  ?member_of=in:<agg1>,<agg2>,!<agg3>

but we support ``!in:`` prefix:

  ?member_of=!in:<agg1>,<agg2>,<agg3>

which is equivalent to:

  ?member_of=!<agg1>&member_of=!<agg2>&member_of=!<agg3>

where candidate resource providers must not be in agg1, agg2, or agg3.

Change-Id: Ibba7981744c71ab5d4d0ee5d5a40709c6a5c6b5e
Story: 2005297
Task: 30183

commit_message:
Add whitebox-tempest-plugin project

Whitebox-tempest-plugin is for testing things that are outside of
Tempest's scope - namely, anything not exposed through the REST APIs.
It is currently being used mainly for Nova whitebox testing, checking
things like configuration settings and libvirt instance XML.

Change-Id: I973995bbbd29d179b0271f2c15d05782d9033f3d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-24 20:48:13.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/legacy/grenade-dsvm-ceilometer/run.yaml', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/upgrade/settings'], 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

Change-Id: If416ba6fe80127f230cffed064da5837d021be80

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: If416ba6fe80127f230cffed064da5837d021be80

subject: Remove and rearrange object bonged proxy tests
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-04-01 15:39:53.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/object_store/v1/test_proxy.py'], 'message': "Remove and rearrange object bonged proxy tests

There are two test classes witha  setUp method and all of their
tests commented out. The commented tests pre-date the merge and
are implemented using httpretty, which is not what we use around
here. The fun part is though, since they subclass the proxy tests,
they are not adding any value - BUT cause the proxy tests to run
multiple times. Just remove them, since they're wasting energy.

Also, there are a couple of tests in their own classes, which is
similarly not the right design, as it causes all of the tests in
the parent class to be run again. Move them into the main class.

Change-Id: Ie328a3cd6e59cb9f40a57cd2c79bbd5890e1f2fe
"}]
commit_message:
Remove and rearrange object bonged proxy tests

There are two test classes witha  setUp method and all of their
tests commented out. The commented tests pre-date the merge and
are implemented using httpretty, which is not what we use around
here. The fun part is though, since they subclass the proxy tests,
they are not adding any value - BUT cause the proxy tests to run
multiple times. Just remove them, since they're wasting energy.

Also, there are a couple of tests in their own classes, which is
similarly not the right design, as it causes all of the tests in
the parent class to be run again. Move them into the main class.

Change-Id: Ie328a3cd6e59cb9f40a57cd2c79bbd5890e1f2fe

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-04-01 15:39:53.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/object_store/v1/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/object_store/v1/test_container.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/object_store/v1/test_account.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/container.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/account.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/_proxy.py'], 'message': "Move set_temp_url_key logic into resource objects

These are resource-specific methods, so they should exist on the
Resource objects. Move the methods there and make the proxy methods
use them. Also, shift tests for them into the object_store tests.
This puts them more where they should be - and puts requests_mock
tests into those files, which is a good example for people.

While we're in there, stop creating a Proxy with a Session and use

Change-Id: I4ba4456ff044c6c2b0c4ab5faeaf3e3cfd77194f

commit_message:
Move set_temp_url_key logic into resource objects

These are resource-specific methods, so they should exist on the
Resource objects. Move the methods there and make the proxy methods
use them. Also, shift tests for them into the object_store tests.
This puts them more where they should be - and puts requests_mock
tests into those files, which is a good example for people.

While we're in there, stop creating a Proxy with a Session and use
the object_store Proxy that exists.

Change-Id: I4ba4456ff044c6c2b0c4ab5faeaf3e3cfd77194f

subject: Migrate rally-database-migration to Ubuntu Bionic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-03 18:05:31.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.d/zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Migrate rally-database-migration to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

This commit mofiy the rally-database-migration job to run on
bionic.

More Details:
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Change-Id: Idab37e177430fde3bd6e3a790fe1f15aec06200c
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate rally-database-migration to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

This commit mofiy the rally-database-migration job to run on
bionic.

More Details:
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Change-Id: Idab37e177430fde3bd6e3a790fe1f15aec06200c

subject: Force C.UTF-8 when dealing with rabbitmq
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-02 12:29:46.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-notify-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-rpc-pacemaker-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Force C.UTF-8 when dealing with rabbitmq

When we use rabbitmq 3.7 we might hit the following issue when running rabbitmqctl commands inside containers (as puppet does):

  Error: Failed to apply catalog: Cannot parse invalid user line: warning:
  the VM is running with native name encoding of latin1 which may cause
  Elixir to malfunction as it expects utf8. Please ensure your locale is
  set to UTF-8 (which can be verified by running "locale" in your shell)

This is fundamentally the tripleo version of
https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/issues/671

This is a strict requirement coming from Elixir:
https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/issues/3548

Since containers do not have UTF-8 as a default we have this problem:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# podman exec -it rabbitmq-bundle-podman-0 sh
()[root@overcloud-controller-0 /]$ rabbitmqctl -q list_users
warning: the VM is running with native name encoding of latin1 which may cause Elixir to malfunction as it expects utf8. Please ensure your locale is set to UTF-8 (which can be verified by ru nning "locale" in your shell) user tags
guest [administrator]
()[root@overcloud-controller-0 /]$ locale
LANG=
LC_CTYPE="POSIX"
LC_NUMERIC="POSIX"
LC_TIME="POSIX"
LC_COLLATE="POSIX"
LC_MONETARY="POSIX"
LC_MESSAGES="POSIX"
LC_PAPER="POSIX"
LC_NAME="POSIX"
LC_ADDRESS="POSIX"
LC_TELEPHONE="POSIX"
LC_MEASUREMENT="POSIX"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="POSIX"
LC_ALL=

This is the THT version of forcing UTF-8 on all rabbitmq_init_bundles
and on epmd itself. The puppet-tripleo one is the depends-on:
Depends-on: I21ef2e7862f3e5e21812d342b1681f8d5f7f005d

Tested on the original environment from Emilien where we saw this issue
during scale-up. After appling this review and its dependency we
correctly got a scaleup with rabbitm3.7 working

Closes-Bug: #1822673
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifc1377811de68bf14ea4aea4dfb52e22a8864d46
'}]
commit_message:
Force C.UTF-8 when dealing with rabbitmq

When we use rabbitmq 3.7 we might hit the following issue when running rabbitmqctl commands inside containers (as puppet does):

  Error: Failed to apply catalog: Cannot parse invalid user line: warning:
  the VM is running with native name encoding of latin1 which may cause
  Elixir to malfunction as it expects utf8. Please ensure your locale is
  set to UTF-8 (which can be verified by running "locale" in your shell)

This is fundamentally the tripleo version of
https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/issues/671

This is a strict requirement coming from Elixir:
https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/issues/3548

Since containers do not have UTF-8 as a default we have this problem:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# podman exec -it rabbitmq-bundle-podman-0 sh
()[root@overcloud-controller-0 /]$ rabbitmqctl -q list_users
warning: the VM is running with native name encoding of latin1 which may cause Elixir to malfunction as it expects utf8. Please ensure your locale is set to UTF-8 (which can be verified by ru nning "locale" in your shell) user tags
guest [administrator]
()[root@overcloud-controller-0 /]$ locale
LANG=
LC_CTYPE="POSIX"
LC_NUMERIC="POSIX"
LC_TIME="POSIX"
LC_COLLATE="POSIX"
LC_MONETARY="POSIX"
LC_MESSAGES="POSIX"
LC_PAPER="POSIX"
LC_NAME="POSIX"
LC_ADDRESS="POSIX"
LC_TELEPHONE="POSIX"
LC_MEASUREMENT="POSIX"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="POSIX"
LC_ALL=

This is the THT version of forcing UTF-8 on all rabbitmq_init_bundles
and on epmd itself. The puppet-tripleo one is the depends-on:
Depends-on: I21ef2e7862f3e5e21812d342b1681f8d5f7f005d

Tested on the original environment from Emilien where we saw this issue
during scale-up. After appling this review and its dependency we
correctly got a scaleup with rabbitm3.7 working

Closes-Bug: #1822673
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifc1377811de68bf14ea4aea4dfb52e22a8864d46

subject: Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
revisions:

git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Id77ad092d3117d38bcacfb9dcb7a0b921145d4cc

commit_message:
Fix misuse of assertTrue

The first argument of assertTrue should not be True,
otherwise the assertTrue will be useless and always pass.

commit_message:
Fix VIP plugging on CentOS-based amphorae

ifup does not provide option -v in CentOS-based amphorae.
This option was added in I0dbb145ab9a0bb8f831c1db28cabd262f9394e7e.

Story: 2005341
Task: 30288

Change-Id: I56947e0d2bb207b59b0b3928efc96546d6410f43

commit_message:

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I9be44f89d2ed5e04ef8b27d03cb2544680419b4f

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia8fa108d2a7b28b062e9ebea560f71e113af9b2f

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

subject: Display first volume image_metadata as an instance image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-28 06:20:47.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py'], 'message': "Display first volume image_metadata as an instance image

When instance is created from cinder volume, it's image is not displayed
Nowdays using cinder as instance source becomes more widespread,
so there is sense in displaying instance image,
when instance is created from cinder volumes.
We're trying to get volume_image_metadata from the first volume of
the instance, when instance doesn't have image attribute itself.
First volume is suggested based on its device name (eg. '/dev/vda').

This info is displayed only in instances list, not in detail overview.

Change-Id: I00aa9ef07d1680bb2390a30271bb39cd7bea6329
(cherry picked from commit 3c82a38f71d52e7a59812c3f2d9f89fe066258f3)
"}]
commit_message:
Display first volume image_metadata as an instance image

When instance is created from cinder volume, it's image is not displayed
Nowdays using cinder as instance source becomes more widespread,
so there is sense in displaying instance image,
when instance is created from cinder volumes.
We're trying to get volume_image_metadata from the first volume of
the instance, when instance doesn't have image attribute itself.
First volume is suggested based on its device name (eg. '/dev/vda').

This info is displayed only in instances list, not in detail overview.

Change-Id: I00aa9ef07d1680bb2390a30271bb39cd7bea6329
(cherry picked from commit 3c82a38f71d52e7a59812c3f2d9f89fe066258f3)

subject: Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-01 13:39:33.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.spec.js'], 'message': "Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
(cherry picked from commit 4788c4d2f59b8aa08e5f599a6d2c327b6004dc0c)
"}]
commit_message:
Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
(cherry picked from commit 4788c4d2f59b8aa08e5f599a6d2c327b6004dc0c)

Set the private key for undercloud tripleo-admin

If a container that isn't suppose to be managed by systemd and is
removed, we used to send a warning saying that no systemd unit file was

Change-Id: I1c4de6e9d1347a20053cb33aea5c3cff20ab979a

commit_message:
systemd: reduce verbosity when removing a container

If a container that isn't suppose to be managed by systemd and is
removed, we used to send a warning saying that no systemd unit file was
found for this container.

Warning is too much, let's just use "info" level for that message.

Change-Id: I1c4de6e9d1347a20053cb33aea5c3cff20ab979a

commit_message:
Add support for generating form-post signatures

swift has the capability of allowing limited access to upload objects
via a pre-generated signature:

  https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/api/form_post_middleware.html

Add methods to support setting keys as well as generating the timestamp
and signature needed to use this.

Change-Id: Iab2fb5c225d0c8e79a16130f2352de1efd6cad4b

commit_message:
Make tripleo-build-containers-centos-7 voting

Assures that the job is triggered when relevant files are touched.

Defines file patterns which could have allowed breaking changes
to go in untested, the implicit ones from parent not being enough.

Change-Id: I5aa4eb466f2369740cd66d087c71c36d44ff7623

subject: [WIP/DNM] This adds the lcm.sh script for lifecylce management
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-01 21:00:08.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/templates/lifecycle-manager.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_db-init.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_db-drop.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_rabbit-init.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_fernet-setup.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_bootstrap.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_credential-setup.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_image-repo-sync.yaml', 'keystone/templates/wf-roles.yaml', 'keystone/values.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_domain-manage.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/_wf-keystone-install.yaml', 'keystone/templates/lifecycle-events/steps/_db-sync.yaml', 'lcm.sh'], 'message': '[WIP/DNM] This adds the lcm.sh script for lifecylce management

Note to reviewers: This commit is a POC, and will not be able to pass
the gates without changing the gates

Problems this commit addresses:

* We want to introduce usage of Argo Workflows to our current process, which
  uses Helm. This doesn't work too well, because a Workflow is a sort of "one
  and done" deal. Once the Helm chart has been installed, there's virtually no
  way to change it, since everything was done by the Workflow, and the Workflow
  can't be rerun
* There's a semantics issue with `helm install` - It makes sense to /deploy/ a
  service, but for upgrading/deleting/backing-up/etc, it's a bit nonsense.

A solution:

* Helm install installs an armada-like object into the cluster.  This object
  knows things like where the chart is located.  It might also be beneficial to
  include configmaps in this object.

* We then supply a handful of Argo Workflows, where each wf is associated with
  a lifecycle event for the chart. We might have these wfs:
  - Install
  - Backup
  - Upgrade
  - Delete
  This solves the issue of including an Argo Workflow into a helm chart

* Finally, we create a lifecycle management tool (lcm.sh in this POC),
  which wraps helm template and kubectl apply to instantiate Workflows.
  The Lifecycle then looks something like this:

  ```
  # Inject the relevant configmaps, secrets, etc into the cluster
  helm install keystone ./keystone --namespace=openstack
  # Instantiate the install workflow
  ./lcm.sh install keystone
  # Make some changes to upgrade the keystone chart,
  # and instantiate the upgrade workflow
  ./lcm.sh install upgrade

Future:
* This process may be streamlined - this needs some experimentation, but it may
  be possible to create generic workflows which work for any given Openstack
  service. That is, rather than having multiple `lifecycle-events` directories,
  we create a single directory which is then shared among all services

Change-Id: I1aa58e077af06e5467488ec195a89813b32229c4
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP/DNM] This adds the lcm.sh script for lifecylce management

Note to reviewers: This commit is a POC, and will not be able to pass
the gates without changing the gates

Problems this commit addresses:

* We want to introduce usage of Argo Workflows to our current process, which
  uses Helm. This doesn't work too well, because a Workflow is a sort of "one
  and done" deal. Once the Helm chart has been installed, there's virtually no
  way to change it, since everything was done by the Workflow, and the Workflow
  can't be rerun
* There's a semantics issue with `helm install` - It makes sense to /deploy/ a
  service, but for upgrading/deleting/backing-up/etc, it's a bit nonsense.

A solution:

* Helm install installs an armada-like object into the cluster.  This object
  knows things like where the chart is located.  It might also be beneficial to
  include configmaps in this object.

* We then supply a handful of Argo Workflows, where each wf is associated with
  a lifecycle event for the chart. We might have these wfs:
  - Install
  - Backup
  - Upgrade
  - Delete
  This solves the issue of including an Argo Workflow into a helm chart

* Finally, we create a lifecycle management tool (lcm.sh in this POC),
  which wraps helm template and kubectl apply to instantiate Workflows.
  The Lifecycle then looks something like this:

  ```
  # Inject the relevant configmaps, secrets, etc into the cluster
  helm install keystone ./keystone --namespace=openstack
  # Instantiate the install workflow
  ./lcm.sh install keystone
  # Make some changes to upgrade the keystone chart,
  # and instantiate the upgrade workflow
  ./lcm.sh install upgrade

Future:
* This process may be streamlined - this needs some experimentation, but it may
  be possible to create generic workflows which work for any given Openstack
  service. That is, rather than having multiple `lifecycle-events` directories,
  we create a single directory which is then shared among all services

Change-Id: I1aa58e077af06e5467488ec195a89813b32229c4

commit_message:
Refactor passing libvirt environment variables

Fixes problems caused by passing of empty environment variables
related to libvirt.

New implementation avoids this and also allows users of the role
to define new default values or to change the passenv values.

Change-Id: Icb27a688c3dbe6eba77254db2e21a041234fe606

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-13 12:21:16.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/pip-and-virtualenv/install.d/pip-and-virtualenv-source-install/04-install-pip'], 'message': "WIP: Avoid overriding system python packages on diskimage_builder

Change behavior of diskimage_builder so it would install and use
the operating system python (pip/setuptools/virtualenv) and install
newer versions using --user.

This makes newer versions available to root user without conflicting
with system packages.

The previous yum/dnf exclude approach did not work well as it would
break packages that do list one of the excluded files as dependencies,
preventing them from being installed or updated, as they could require
a newer version of these packages.

The entire altering of basic operating system to inject newer packages
works againt testing policy where we need to test compatibility of our
code with a specific operating system. If we test it with somethign
that is no longer a supported version of the operating system, the
result of the testing is not to be valid anymore as is likely that
it will miss to spot bugs that would be faced by the customer.

It is ok to install newer packages as long they are not installed in
the same location as system packages. That's where pip `--user` comes
handy, the only downside is that it needs to be done for each user that
would want to benefit from it. Arguably the build jobs can take care of
this themselves as this does not require root access.

Change-Id: Ie9a1002c0bcdfec56a236e348d064cd560669313
Related-Bug: #1808118
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Avoid overriding system python packages on diskimage_builder

Change behavior of diskimage_builder so it would install and use
the operating system python (pip/setuptools/virtualenv) and install
newer versions using --user.

This makes newer versions available to root user without conflicting
with system packages.

The previous yum/dnf exclude approach did not work well as it would
break packages that do list one of the excluded files as dependencies,
preventing them from being installed or updated, as they could require
a newer version of these packages.

The entire altering of basic operating system to inject newer packages
works againt testing policy where we need to test compatibility of our
code with a specific operating system. If we test it with somethign
that is no longer a supported version of the operating system, the
result of the testing is not to be valid anymore as is likely that
it will miss to spot bugs that would be faced by the customer.

It is ok to install newer packages as long they are not installed in
the same location as system packages. That's where pip `--user` comes
handy, the only downside is that it needs to be done for each user that
would want to benefit from it. Arguably the build jobs can take care of
this themselves as this does not require root access.

Change-Id: Ie9a1002c0bcdfec56a236e348d064cd560669313
Related-Bug: #1808118

commit_message:
Quiesce assertRaisesRegexp deprecation messages

Glance tests are currently too verbose for subunit and make
them randomly fail under python 3.

Using six.assertRaisesRegex() should get rid of the
"PendingDeprecationWarning: Please use assertRaisesRegex instead"
messages.

Change-Id: I3297757b640bba9204243d2816bb3eb3aea0e4b4

subject: Workaround for random virtualenv recreation failure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2019-01-18 10:04:23.000000000', 'files': ['quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'Workaround for random virtualenv recreation failure

Recreating a virtualenv can fix some of its problems but there are
cases where nothign can be done. One such example is when there is a
lingering python process that is using this virtualenv.

We may not be able to kill the proces (or not a good idea) so better
we display an unique message, list python processes, move the folder
and recreate a clean virtualenv. This should prevent a failure while
still getting traceable information regarding when it occurs.

Change-Id: Idfa4980215cb5489aa94c4ee7e55cdd160ed77d6
Closes-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1792375
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for random virtualenv recreation failure

Recreating a virtualenv can fix some of its problems but there are
cases where nothign can be done. One such example is when there is a
lingering python process that is using this virtualenv.

We may not be able to kill the proces (or not a good idea) so better
we display an unique message, list python processes, move the folder
and recreate a clean virtualenv. This should prevent a failure while
still getting traceable information regarding when it occurs.

Change-Id: Idfa4980215cb5489aa94c4ee7e55cdd160ed77d6
Closes-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1792375

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I45b6a99b96436e12081cc7a021779b832c664c88

commit_message:
Correct use of force_tcg with libguestfs

Use force_tcg for virt-resize and virt-customize if the
libguestfs-test-tool fails.

Also dump virt-resize, virt-customize and libguestfs-test-tools to
log files.

Change-Id: I767da273629d3e8979ea980eade47e67409e090b
Related-Bug: #1743749

commit_message:
Use hostname of machine for ``binding_host_id``

The current implementation relies on DNS to resolve the hostname
associated with the ``private-address`` IP of the unit.

This does not always provide a reliable result.

Change-Id: I3a3a3cddd35354944196a155ca0b239e680333d3
Closes-Bug: #1823000

subject: Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-24 21:07:13.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/devstack_setup.rst', 'playbooks/legacy/cyborg-devstack/run.yaml', 'doc/source/install/from-source.rst'], 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Icaa4c41666e41693baba9db89c6ed2709e2836d1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-03 07:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['elements/undercloud-install/os-refresh-config/configure.d/40-stop-running-epmd'], 'message': '[Queens-only] Restart Erlang VM on undercloud upgrade

When running an undercloud upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer
major version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running
Erlang Port Mapper Daemon (epmd) nor RabbitMQ.

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]. This confuses
RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

    ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

    $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
    Error: invalid parameter: []

Make sure to restart both epmd and RabbitMQ if they are running,
to start the upgrade from a valid erlang runtime.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Change-Id: I6f486b0b70f19d8b4916ef500675c0739939e060
Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens-only] Restart Erlang VM on undercloud upgrade

When running an undercloud upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer
major version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running
Erlang Port Mapper Daemon (epmd) nor RabbitMQ.

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]. This confuses
RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

    ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

    $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
    Error: invalid parameter: []

Make sure to restart both epmd and RabbitMQ if they are running,
to start the upgrade from a valid erlang runtime.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Change-Id: I6f486b0b70f19d8b4916ef500675c0739939e060
Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Disable beaker jobs for now

The centos packaging is broken because congress recently bumped their
psycopg2 requirement to version >= 2.7 but RDO only ships version 2.5.
Basically installing congress doesn't seem to be working on centos or
ubuntu at the moment so we need to kill the beaker jobs so we can land
the stein branch bits.

Change-Id: Iccbf3dbff9f21c1ee2dc075c1324670d66bc0aa7
(cherry picked from commit dfedf04e899d6ef13509a7588d7038d8a9bc4a1d)

Typically, non-executable files should have 660 or 600 and executable
files and directories should have 770. All should be owned by the
'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group' variables.

This change adds a script to check the owner and permissions of config

commit_message:
Check configuration file permissions in CI

Typically, non-executable files should have 660 or 600 and executable
files and directories should have 770. All should be owned by the
'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group' variables.

This change adds a script to check the owner and permissions of config
files under /etc/kolla, and runs it at the end of CI jobs.

Change-Id: Icdbabf36e284b9030017a0dc07b9dc81a37758ab
Related-Bug: #1821579

subject: Add support for pacemaker-remotes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2019-04-03 10:51:42.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'hooks/utils.py', 'hooks/pacemaker-remote-relation-joined', 'hooks/pacemaker-remote-relation-changed', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_utils.py', 'metadata.yaml', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_hooks.py'], 'message': "Add support for pacemaker-remotes

This change adds support for pacmaker-remots joining the cluster
via the pacemaher-remote relation. The pacemaker-remotes can
advertise whether they should host resources. If the
pacemaker-remotes are only being used for failure detection
(as is the case with masakari host monitors) then they
will not host resources.

Pacemaker remotes are managed in the cluster as resources
which nominally run on a member in the main cluster. The
resource that corresponds to the pacemaker-remote is managed
via configure_pacemaker_remotes and configure_pacemaker_remote
functions.

If the pacemaker-remotes should not run resources then the
cluster needs to be switched to an opt-in cluster. In an
opt-in cluster location rules are needed to explicitly
allow a resource to run on a specific node. This behaviour
is controlled via the global cluster parameter 'symmetric-cluster'
this is set via the new method set_cluster_symmetry. The method
add_location_rules_for_local_nodes is used for creating these
explicit rules.

Change-Id: I0a66cfb1ecad02c2b185c5e6402e77f713d25f8b
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for pacemaker-remotes

This change adds support for pacmaker-remots joining the cluster
via the pacemaher-remote relation. The pacemaker-remotes can
advertise whether they should host resources. If the
pacemaker-remotes are only being used for failure detection
(as is the case with masakari host monitors) then they
will not host resources.

Pacemaker remotes are managed in the cluster as resources
which nominally run on a member in the main cluster. The
resource that corresponds to the pacemaker-remote is managed
via configure_pacemaker_remotes and configure_pacemaker_remote
functions.

If the pacemaker-remotes should not run resources then the
cluster needs to be switched to an opt-in cluster. In an
opt-in cluster location rules are needed to explicitly
allow a resource to run on a specific node. This behaviour
is controlled via the global cluster parameter 'symmetric-cluster'
this is set via the new method set_cluster_symmetry. The method
add_location_rules_for_local_nodes is used for creating these
explicit rules.

Change-Id: I0a66cfb1ecad02c2b185c5e6402e77f713d25f8b

subject: New member_ready state in peer relation
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-04-03 10:51:42.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'hooks/utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_utils.py'], 'message': "New member_ready state in peer relation

This change adds a new 'member_ready' state to the peer relation.
This purpose of this is to indicate that a unit has rendered its
configuration and started its services. This is distinct from the
existing 'ready' indicator. 'ready' indicates that the unit can
render its config and start services and ensures that all units are
present prior to starting services. This seems to safe guard
against units starting to early and forming single node clusters or
small clusters with a sub-set of units. The 'member_ready' flag
is later in the process and if it is set it shows that this unit
has joined the cluster and can be referenceed explicitly in any
resource configuration.

Change-Id: I80d42a628a3fe51bc6f8d02610031afd9386d7a4
"}]
commit_message:
New member_ready state in peer relation

This change adds a new 'member_ready' state to the peer relation.
This purpose of this is to indicate that a unit has rendered its
configuration and started its services. This is distinct from the
existing 'ready' indicator. 'ready' indicates that the unit can
render its config and start services and ensures that all units are
present prior to starting services. This seems to safe guard
against units starting to early and forming single node clusters or
small clusters with a sub-set of units. The 'member_ready' flag
is later in the process and if it is set it shows that this unit
has joined the cluster and can be referenceed explicitly in any
resource configuration.

Change-Id: I80d42a628a3fe51bc6f8d02610031afd9386d7a4

commit_message:
Use XML to get node list

The current list_nodes command tries to parse the output of
"crm node list" to get a list of nodes. But the output is messy if
remote nodes are present so use "crm node status" to get properly
formatted XML which can be reliably parsed.

Change-Id: Iea7ef3dca194e7440dc2cde2624d07e990006685

commit_message:

The centos packaging is broken because congress recently bumped their
psycopg2 requirement to version >= 2.7 but RDO only ships version 2.5.
Basically installing congress doesn't seem to be working on centos or
ubuntu at the moment so we need to kill the beaker jobs so we can land
the stein branch bits.

subject: Add pacemaker authkey
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-04-03 10:51:42.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/utils.py', 'config.yaml', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_utils.py'], 'message': 'Add pacemaker authkey

To work with pacemaker remotes all pacemaker nodes (including the
remotes) need to share a common key in the same way that corosync
does. This change allows a user to set a pacemaker key via config
in the same way as corosync. If the pacemaker key value is unset
then the corosync key is user.

Change-Id: I75247e7f3af29fc0907a94ae8e1678bdb9ee64e2
'}]
commit_message:
Add pacemaker authkey

To work with pacemaker remotes all pacemaker nodes (including the
remotes) need to share a common key in the same way that corosync
does. This change allows a user to set a pacemaker key via config
in the same way as corosync. If the pacemaker key value is unset
then the corosync key is user.

Change-Id: I75247e7f3af29fc0907a94ae8e1678bdb9ee64e2

This is useful in the situation where a cluster without any resources
is needed.

subject: tempest: don't use DVR with FWaaS v1
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-03-27 10:24:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_fwaas.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': "tempest: don't use DVR with FWaaS v1

When tempest creates routers for the FWaaS v1 scenario test cases,
if DVR is enabled by default for routers, these test cases will
fail. This commit adds some logic to create centralized routers
explicitly for those test cases, or skip the test cases if a
DVR router is already provided via the `network.public_router_id`
option.

This commit also uses admin tempest credentials to create routers,
because this is required to access the distributed router option.

Change-Id: I81269a499f805134a9368f2774320de972f9c24c
"}]
commit_message:
tempest: don't use DVR with FWaaS v1

When tempest creates routers for the FWaaS v1 scenario test cases,
if DVR is enabled by default for routers, these test cases will
fail. This commit adds some logic to create centralized routers
explicitly for those test cases, or skip the test cases if a
DVR router is already provided via the `network.public_router_id`
option.

This commit also uses admin tempest credentials to create routers,
because this is required to access the distributed router option.

Change-Id: I81269a499f805134a9368f2774320de972f9c24c

commit_message:
tempest: don't use DVR routers

When tempest creates routers for the scenario test cases,
if DVR is enabled by default for routers, these test cases
will fail. This commit adds some logic to create centralized
routers explicitly for those test cases.

Change-Id: I00d64aaaae6822a8e82a269fb8275ff460d64641

commit_message:
Remove "supports_recreate" from capabilities

The changeset to close bug 1821891 added the
field "supports_evacuate" in the driver
capabilities without removing "supports_recreate",
which was the old field for the same.

Change-Id: If93ed659dfcbe7dc2820e6110c5878adaf0de158
Closes-Bug: #1822853

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I02b88da25e80c71780c1ddb6e6ecf94cd179c90d

commit_message:
Bootstrap the v2 API

This adds a v2 API root to CloudKitty. An example endpoint along with some
developer documentation has been added. The API root is now served with Flask
instead of pecan.

Change-Id: I4ede52dae531631f7fe708400def01bc08a64dec
Story: 2004208
Task: 27717
Task: 27718
Task: 27719

commit_message:
Fix up config file permissions on the host

Several config file permissions are incorrect on the host. In general,
files should be 0660, and directories and executables 0770.

Change-Id: Id276ac1864f280554e98b937f2845bb424d521de
Closes-Bug: #1821579

commit_message:
Improve tempest plugins installation

Instead of ignoring installation failure, new code would fail if
tempest plugins cannot be installed and also work if there are
no plugins specified.

Change-Id: Ic5ea1bf75cd30f8af6d9a3586a0073ff5c54cb27
Related-Bug: #1787912

commit_message:
Fix bug preventing forbidden traits from working

Modifies _clean_empties function to take forbidden traits into account
in addition to required traits.

Added unit test test_resources_from_request_spec_flavor_forbidden_trait
to test that a single forbidden trait doesn't get lost in the
resources_from_request_spec function.

Also updated the functional test
test_flavor_forbidden_traits_based_scheduling to do the right thing.

Change-Id: I491b10c9c202baae4a37034848147f910a50eebf
Closes-Bug: #1821824

commit_message:
Generate inventory for mistral ssh

All of the calls to get_tripleo_ansible_inventory will then pass this
inventory to mistral, so the inventory entry for the undercloud needs
to use ssh as the connection.

Change-Id: I68ad49f103af79ab4b82b499b8620af9470f1ef9
Closes-Bug: #1822518
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649459/

subject: DevStack: Fix Amphora->kubelet port connectivity
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-02 21:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/lib/kuryr_kubernetes'], 'message': 'DevStack: Fix Amphora->kubelet port connectivity

Due to some unknown changes in either Neutron, Octavia or anything else,
we lost the Amphora->kubelet port connectivity that was crucial for our
K8s API LB to function.

To work around this this commit adds --subnet-id argument when creating
LB member. This makes Octavia attach pod subnet to the Amphora VM. In
order to make this work a security group that accepts traffic from pod
subnet is also added to kubelet port.

Change-Id: I764f8fd1d53ba5936c68519583e973188b82db08
Closes-Bug: 1822862
'}]
commit_message:
DevStack: Fix Amphora->kubelet port connectivity

Due to some unknown changes in either Neutron, Octavia or anything else,
we lost the Amphora->kubelet port connectivity that was crucial for our
K8s API LB to function.

To work around this this commit adds --subnet-id argument when creating
LB member. This makes Octavia attach pod subnet to the Amphora VM. In
order to make this work a security group that accepts traffic from pod
subnet is also added to kubelet port.

Change-Id: I764f8fd1d53ba5936c68519583e973188b82db08
Closes-Bug: 1822862

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (4)

Replace mox with mock
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.

This patch adds the '_test_allocate_for_instance_with_virtual_interface'
method in the _TestNeutronv2Common class for test cases using mock
instead of the '_allocate_for_instance' method
in the TestNeutronv2Base class.

The '_allocate_for_instance' method will be removed
when replacing mox is completed in test methods using
the '_allocate_for_instance' method.

This patch moves the following methods in the TestNeutronv2 class
to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_allocate_for_instance_1
* test_allocate_for_instance_accepts_macs_kwargs_None
* test_allocate_for_instance_accepts_macs_kwargs_set
* test_allocate_for_instance_with_mac_added_to_port
* test_allocate_for_instance_accepts_only_portid
* test_allocate_for_instance_two_macs_two_networks
* test_allocate_for_instance_with_requested_non_available_network
* test_allocate_for_instance_with_requested_networks
* test_allocate_for_instance_with_no_subnet_defined
* test_allocate_for_instance_with_requested_networks_with_fixedip
* test_allocate_for_instance_with_requested_networks_with_port
* test_allocate_for_instance_second_time
* test_allocate_for_instance_with_requested_networks_duplicates
* test_allocate_for_instance_requested_networks_duplicates_port
* test_allocate_for_instance_requested_networks_duplicates_combo

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: Ibbc004a9175462dc31d30ab44b188de867d94d57
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-train

commit_message:
Add tempest_test_whitelist to allowed_override

This patch add tempest_test_whitelist to allowed_overrides list, as well
as the list of default tempest tests to be executed by os_tempest job.
This new variable is required to os_tempest based job get executed
properly.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/900?kanban-status=1447275
Change-Id: Id67193f1a7b9a5e93c2a2ba687da920d147c9ab0

commit_message:
Docs: emulator threads: clarify expected behavior

This patch adds a table of possible extra-spec/cpu_shared_set
combinations, and lists the expected behavior of instance emulator
threads for each case. This is an improvement over the previous doc,
which incorrectly implied that `share` was the default policy value,
and only covered what happens if cpu_shared_set is set.

Change-Id: Ia56607d0b70d5f46159b57ee1092ba0e37a02270

subject: Don't allow deletion of HA port of router
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-04-03 02:29:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/ports/tables.py'], 'message': "Don't allow deletion of HA port of router

When the neutron_lbaas is configurated and enabled,
the created router will be HA router. Every router
instance will has a HA port which to keep them alived.
Those ports, whose device-owner is router_ha_interface,
will shown on page.
But there will throw an NotFound error when deleting them.
IMO, it is enough for user to known them exist. we
don't need to operate them for they only using by router
instance.

Change-Id: I276b5754b936d03b87b1e8ef39097a130e309211
"}]
commit_message:
Don't allow deletion of HA port of router

When the neutron_lbaas is configurated and enabled,
the created router will be HA router. Every router
instance will has a HA port which to keep them alived.
Those ports, whose device-owner is router_ha_interface,
will shown on page.
But there will throw an NotFound error when deleting them.
IMO, it is enough for user to known them exist. we
don't need to operate them for they only using by router
instance.

Change-Id: I276b5754b936d03b87b1e8ef39097a130e309211
